# itemTitle(at:)

**Instance Method**

Returns the title of the item at the specified index.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func itemTitle(at index: Int) -> String
```

## Parameters

- **index**: The index of the item you want.

## Return Value

The title of the item, or an empty string if no item exists at the specified index.

## Related Documentation

- **item(at:)**: Returns the menu item at the specified index.

## Title conveniences

- **itemTitles**: An array of `NSString` objects containing the titles of every item in the menu.
- **titleOfSelectedItem**: The title of the item last selected by the user.
